title: Historical accuracy question
content: I am trying to find an example of the layout of an act of parliament from the years 17th and 18th centuries. I intend to letterpress a copy of the Witchcraft act of 1604 and of 1736 and I want to at least get some of the details right, such as the choice of fount. Can anyone help me?
author: roland_scriver

comments.content:
English courthand of the 16th century   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/cs-courthand/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145048/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/cs-courthand/)   
   
 [http://www.dabbler.com/sca/scrolls/courtbat.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145048/http:/www.dabbler.com/sca/scrolls/courtbat.gif)  
   
there was a book at the Univeristy of Reading Uk library   
called something like 'English Courthand of the 15-16 century"
